im_format_all.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /** \file
00002  * \brief All the Internal File Formats.
00003  * They are all automatically registered by the library.
00004  * The signatures are in C, but the functions are C++.
00005  * Header for internal use only.
00006  *
00007  * See Copyright Notice in im_lib.h
00008  */
00009 
00010 #ifndef __IM_FORMAT_ALL_H
00011 #define __IM_FORMAT_ALL_H
00012 
00013 #if     defined(__cplusplus)
00014 extern "C" {
00015 #endif
00016 
00017 /** \defgroup tiff TIFF - Tagged Image File Format
00018  * \section Description
00019  *
00020  * \par
00021  * Copyright (c) 1986-1988, 1992 by Adobe Systems Incorporated. \n
00022  * Originally created by a group of companies,
00023  * the Aldus Corporation keeped the copyright until Aldus was aquired by Adobe. \n
00024  * TIFF Revision 6.0 Final — June 3, 1992 \n
00025  * http://www.adobe.com/Support/TechNotes.html
00026  * \par
00027  * Access to the TIFF file format uses libTIFF version 4.0.0 \n
00028  * http://www.remotesensing.org/libtiff/                     \n
00029  * Copyright (c) 1988-1997 Sam Leffler                      \n
00030  * Copyright (c) 1991-1997 Silicon Graphics, Inc.           \n
00031  *
00032  * \section Features
00033  *
00034 \verbatim
00035     Data Types: <all>
00036     Color Spaces: Gray, RGB, CMYK, YCbCr, Lab, XYZ, Map and Binary.
00037     Compressions:
00038       NONE - no compression  [default for IEEE Floating Point Data]
00039       CCITTRLE - CCITT modified Huffman RLE (binary only) [default for Binary]
00040       CCITTFAX3 - CCITT Group 3 fax         (binary only)
00041       CCITTFAX4 - CCITT Group 4 fax         (binary only)
00042       LZW - Lempel-Ziv & Welch  [default]
00043       JPEG - ISO JPEG    [default for YCBCR]
00044       NEXT - NeXT 2-bit RLE (2 bpp only)
00045       CCITTRLEW - CCITT modified Huffman RLE with word alignment (binary only)
00046       RLE - Packbits (Macintosh RLE) [default for MAP]
00047       THUNDERSCAN - ThunderScan 4-bit RLE (only for 2 or 4 bpp)
00048       PIXARLOG - Pixar companded 11-bit ZIP (only byte, ushort and float)
00049       DEFLATE - LZ77 variation (ZIP)
00050       ADOBE_DEFLATE - Adobe LZ77 variation
00051       SGILOG - SGI Log Luminance RLE for L and Luv (only byte, ushort and float) [default for XYZ]
00052       SGILOG24 - SGI Log 24-bit packed for Luv (only byte, ushort and float)
00053     Can have more than one image.
00054     Can have an alpha channel.
00055     Components can be packed or not.
00056     Lines arranged from top down to bottom or bottom up to top.
00057     Handle(1) returns a TIFF* libTIFF structure.
00058 
00059     Attributes:
00060       Photometric IM_USHORT (1) (when writing this will complement the color_mode information, for Mask, MinIsWhite, ITULab and ICCLab)
00061       ExtraSampleInfo IM_USHORT (1) (description of alpha channel: 0- uknown, 1- pre-multiplied, 2-normal)
00062       JPEGQuality IM_INT (1) [0-100, default 75] (write only)
00063       ZIPQuality IM_INT (1) [1-9, default 6] (write only)
00064       ResolutionUnit (string) ["DPC", "DPI"]
00065       XResolution, YResolution IM_FLOAT (1)
00066       Description, Author, Copyright, DateTime, DocumentName,
00067       PageName, TargetPrinter, Make, Model, Software, HostComputer (string)
00068       InkNames (strings separated by '0's)
00069       InkSet IM_USHORT (1)
00070       NumberOfInks IM_USHORT (1)
00071       DotRange IM_USHORT (2)
00072       TransferFunction0, TransferFunction1, TransferFunction3 IM_USHORT [gray=0, rgb=012]
00073       ReferenceBlackWhite IMFLOAT (6)
00074       WhitePoint IMFLOAT (2)
00075       PrimaryChromaticities  IMFLOAT (6)
00076       YCbCrCoefficients IM_FLOAT (3)
00077       YCbCrSubSampling IM_USHORT (2)
00078       YCbCrPositioning IM_USHORT (1)
00079       PageNumber IM_USHORT (2)
00080       StoNits IM_FLOAT (1)
00081       XPosition, YPosition IM_FLOAT (1)
00082       SMinSampleValue, SMaxSampleValue IM_FLOAT (1)
00083       HalftoneHints IM_USHORT (2)
00084       SubfileType IM_INT (1)
00085       ICCProfile IM_BYTE (N)
00086       MultiBandCount IM_USHORT (1)    [Number of bands in a multiband gray image.]
00087       MultiBandSelect IM_USHORT (1)   [Band number to read one band of a multiband gray image. Must be set before reading image info.]
00088       and other TIFF tags as they are described in the TIFF documentation.
00089       GeoTIFF tags:
00090         GeoTiePoints, GeoTransMatrix, IntergraphMatrix, GeoPixelScale, GeoDoubleParams IM_FLOAT (N)
00091         GeoASCIIParams (string)
00092       Read-only support for EXIF tags as they are described in the EXIF 2.2 documentation. See http://www.exif.org/
00093       DNG tags as they are described in the DNG documentation. See http://www.adobe.com/br/products/dng/
00094         Tags BlackLevel, DefaultCropOrigin and DefaultCropSize are incorrectly interpreted by libTIFF so they are ignored.
00095         Raw image is loaded in place of the thumbnail image in the main IFD.
00096         SubIFDCount IM_USHORT (1)    [Number of subifds of the current image.]
00097         SubIFDSelect IM_USHORT (1)   [Subifd number to be read. Must be set before reading image info.]
00098       (other attributes can be obtained by using libTIFF directly using the Handle(1) function)
00099 
00100     Comments:
00101       LogLuv is in fact Y'+CIE(u,v), so we choose to always convert it to XYZ.
00102       SubIFD is handled only for DNG.
00103       Since LZW patent expired, LZW compression is enabled. LZW Copyright Unisys.
00104       libGeoTIFF can be used without XTIFF initialization. Use Handle(1) to obtain a TIFF*.
00105 
00106     Changes:
00107       "tiff_jpeg.c" - commented "downsampled_output = TRUE" and downsampled_input = TRUE.
00108       New files "tif_config.h" and "tifconf.h" to match our needs.
00109       New file "tiff_binfile.c" that implement I/O rotines using imBinFile.
00110       Search for "IMLIB" to see the changes.
00111 \endverbatim
00112  * \ingroup format */
00113 void imFormatRegisterTIFF(void);
00114 
00115 
00116 /** \defgroup jpeg JPEG - JPEG File Interchange Format
00117  * \section Description
00118  *
00119  * \par
00120  * ISO/IEC 10918 (1994, 1995, 1997, 1999)\n
00121  * http://www.jpeg.org/
00122  * \par
00123  * Access to the JPEG file format uses libjpeg version 8c. \n
00124  * http://www.ijg.org                                      \n
00125  * Copyright (C) 1994-2011, Thomas G. Lane, Guido Vollbeding  \n
00126  *   from the Independent JPEG Group.
00127  * \par
00128  * Access to the EXIF attributes uses libEXIF version 0.6.20. \n
00129  * http://sourceforge.net/projects/libexif                    \n
00130  * Copyright (C) 2001-2010, Lutz Müller
00131  *
00132  * \section Features
00133  *
00134 \verbatim
00135     Data Types: Byte
00136     Color Spaces: Gray, RGB, CMYK and YCbCr (Binary Saved as Gray)
00137     Compressions:
00138       JPEG - ISO JPEG  [default]
00139     Only one image.
00140     No alpha channel.
00141     Internally the components are always packed.
00142     Internally the lines are arranged from top down to bottom.
00143     Handle(1) returns jpeg_decompress_struct* when reading, and
00144                       jpeg_compress_struct* when writing (libJPEG structures).
00145 
00146     Attributes:
00147       AutoYCbCr IM_INT (1) (controls YCbCr auto conversion) default 1
00148       JPEGQuality IM_INT (1) [0-100, default 75] (write only)
00149       ResolutionUnit (string) ["DPC", "DPI"]
00150       XResolution, YResolution IM_FLOAT (1)
00151       Interlaced (same as Progressive) IM_INT (1 | 0) default 0
00152       Description (string)
00153       (lots of Exif tags)
00154 
00155     Changes to libJPEG:
00156       jdatadst.c - fflush and ferror replaced by macros JFFLUSH and JFERROR.
00157       jinclude.h - standard JFFLUSH and JFERROR definitions, and new macro HAVE_JFIO.
00158       new file created: jconfig.h from jconfig.txt
00159 
00160     Changes to libEXIF:
00161       new files config.h and _stdint.h
00162       small fixes in exif-entry.c, exif-loader.c, exif-tag.c, mnote-fuji-tag.h and mnote-olympus-tag.h
00163 
00164     Comments:
00165       Other APPx markers are ignored.
00166       No thumbnail support.
00167       RGB images are automatically converted to YCbCr when saved.
00168       Also YcbCr are automatically converted to RGB when loaded. Use AutoYCbCr=0 to disable this behavior.
00169 \endverbatim
00170  * \ingroup format */
00171 void imFormatRegisterJPEG(void);
00172 
00173 
00174 /** \defgroup png PNG - Portable Network Graphic Format
00175  * \section Description
00176  *
00177  * \par
00178  * Access to the PNG file format uses libpng version 1.5.7. \n
00179  * http://www.libpng.org                                    \n
00180  * Copyright (C) 1998-2011 Glenn Randers-Pehrson
00181  *
00182  * \section Features
00183  *
00184 \verbatim
00185     Data Types: Byte and UShort
00186     Color Spaces: Gray, RGB, MAP and Binary
00187     Compressions:
00188       DEFLATE - LZ77 variation (ZIP) [default]
00189     Only one image.
00190     Can have an alpha channel.
00191     Internally the components are always packed.
00192     Internally the lines are arranged from top down to bottom.
00193     Handle(1) returns png_structp libPNG structure.
00194 
00195     Attributes:
00196       ZIPQuality IM_INT (1) [1-9, default 6] (write only)
00197       ResolutionUnit (string) ["DPC", "DPI"]
00198       XResolution, YResolution IM_FLOAT (1)
00199       Interlaced (same as Progressive) IM_INT (1 | 0) default 0
00200       Gamma IM_FLOAT (1)
00201       WhitePoint IMFLOAT (2)
00202       PrimaryChromaticities  IMFLOAT (6)
00203       XPosition, YPosition IM_FLOAT (1)
00204       sRGBIntent IM_INT (1) [0: Perceptual, 1: Relative colorimetric, 2: Saturation, 3: Absolute colorimetric]
00205       TransparencyMap IM_BYTE (N) (for MAP images is the alpha value of the corresponding palette index)
00206       TransparencyIndex IM_BYTE (1) (for MAP images is the first index that has minimum alpha in TransparencyMap, for GRAY images is the index that it is fully transparent)
00207       TransparencyColor IM_BYTE (3) (for RGB images is the color that is full transparent)
00208       CalibrationName, CalibrationUnits (string)
00209       CalibrationLimits IM_INT (2)
00210       CalibrationEquation IM_BYTE (1) [0-Linear,1-Exponential,2-Arbitrary,3-HyperbolicSine)]
00211       CalibrationParam (string) [params separated by '\\n']
00212       Title, Author, Description, Copyright, DateTime (string)
00213       Software, Disclaimer, Warning, Source, Comment, ...       (string)
00214       DateTimeModified (string) [when writing uses the current system time]
00215       ICCProfile IM_BYTE (N)
00216       ScaleUnit (string) ["meters", "radians"]
00217       XScale, YScale IM_FLOAT (1)
00218 
00219     Comments:
00220       When saving PNG image with TransparencyIndex or TransparencyMap, TransparencyMap has precedence, 
00221         so set it to NULL if you changed TransparencyIndex.
00222       Attributes set after the image are ignored.
00223 \endverbatim
00224  * \ingroup format */
00225 void imFormatRegisterPNG(void);
00226 
00227 
00228 /** \defgroup gif GIF - Graphics Interchange Format
00229  * \section Description
00230  *
00231  * \par
00232  * Copyright (c) 1987,1988,1989,1990 CompuServe Incorporated. \n
00233  * GIF is a Service Mark property of CompuServe Incorporated. \n
00234  * Graphics Interchange Format Programming Reference, 1990. \n
00235  * LZW Copyright Unisys.
00236  * \par
00237  * Patial Internal Implementation. \n
00238  * Decoding and encoding code were extracted from GIFLib 1.0. \n
00239  * Copyright (c) 1989 Gershon Elber.
00240  *
00241  * \section Features
00242  *
00243 \verbatim
00244     Data Types: Byte
00245     Color Spaces: MAP only, (Gray and Binary saved as MAP)
00246     Compressions:
00247       LZW - Lempel-Ziv & Welch      [default]
00248     Can have more than one image.
00249     No alpha channel.
00250     Internally the lines are arranged from top down to bottom.
00251 
00252     Attributes:
00253       ScreenHeight, ScreenWidth IM_USHORT (1) screen size [default to the first image size]
00254       Interlaced IM_INT (1 | 0) default 0
00255       Description (string)
00256       TransparencyIndex IM_BYTE (1)
00257       XScreen, YScreen IM_USHORT (1) screen position
00258       UserInput IM_BYTE (1) [1, 0]
00259       Disposal (string) [UNDEF, LEAVE, RBACK, RPREV]
00260       Delay IM_USHORT (1) [time to wait betweed frames in 1/100 of a second]
00261       Iterations IM_USHORT (1) (NETSCAPE2.0 Application Extension) [The number of times to repeat the animation. 0 means to repeat forever. ]
00262 
00263     Comments:
00264       Attributes after the last image are ignored.
00265       Reads GIF87 and GIF89, but writes GIF89 always.
00266       Ignored attributes: Background Color Index, Pixel Aspect Ratio,
00267                           Plain Text Extensions, Application Extensions...
00268 \endverbatim
00269  * \ingroup format */
00270 void imFormatRegisterGIF(void);
00271 
00272 
00273 /** \defgroup bmp BMP - Windows Device Independent Bitmap
00274  * \section Description
00275  *
00276  * \par
00277  * Windows Copyright Microsoft Corporation.
00278  * \par
00279  * Internal Implementation.
00280  *
00281  * \section Features
00282  *
00283 \verbatim
00284     Data Types: Byte
00285     Color Spaces: RGB, MAP and Binary (Gray saved as MAP)
00286     Compressions:
00287       NONE - no compression [default]
00288       RLE  - Run Lenght Encoding (only for MAP and Gray)
00289     Only one image.
00290     Can have an alpha channel (only for RGB)
00291     Internally the components are always packed.
00292     Lines arranged from top down to bottom or bottom up to top. But are saved always as bottom up.
00293 
00294     Attributes:
00295       ResolutionUnit (string) ["DPC", "DPI"]
00296       XResolution, YResolution IM_FLOAT (1)
00297 
00298     Comments:
00299       Reads OS2 1.x and Windows 3, but writes Windows 3 always.
00300       Version 4 and 5 BMPs are not supported.
00301 \endverbatim
00302  * \ingroup format */
00303 void imFormatRegisterBMP(void);
00304

00307  * \section Description
00308  *
00309  * \par
00310  * Copyright Sun Corporation.
00311  * \par
00312  * Internal Implementation.
00313  *
00314  * \section Features
00315  *
00316 \verbatim
00317     Data Types: Byte
00318     Color Spaces: Gray, RGB, MAP and Binary
00319     Compressions:
00320       NONE - no compression   [default]
00321       RLE  - Run Lenght Encoding
00322     Only one image.
00323     Can have an alpha channel (only for IM_RGB)
00324     Internally the components are always packed.
00325     Internally the lines are arranged from top down to bottom.
00326 
00327     Attributes:
00328       none
00329 \endverbatim
00330  * \ingroup format */
00331 void imFormatRegisterRAS(void);

00339  * \par
00340  * Internal Implementation.
00341  *
00342  * \section Features
00343  *
00344 \verbatim
00345     Data Types: Byte
00346     Color Spaces: MAP only (Gray and Binary saved as MAP)
00347     Compressions:
00348       NONE - no compression  [default]
00349     Only one image.
00350     No alpha channel.
00351     Internally the lines are arranged from top down to bottom.
00352 
00353     Attributes:
00354       none
00355 
00356     Comments:
00357       LED file must start with "LEDImage = IMAGE[".
00358 \endverbatim
00359  * \ingroup format */

00363 /** \defgroup sgi SGI - Silicon Graphics Image File Format
00364  * \section Description
00365  *
00366  * \par
00367  * SGI is a trademark of Silicon Graphics, Inc.
00368  * \par
00369  * Internal Implementation.
00370  *
00371  * \section Features
00372  *
00373 \verbatim
00374     Data Types: Byte and UShort
00375     Color Spaces: Gray and RGB (Binary saved as Gray, MAP with fixed palette when reading only)
00376     Compressions:
00377       NONE - no compression  [default]
00378       RLE  - Run Lenght Encoding
00379     Only one image.
00380     Can have an alpha channel (only for IM_RGB)
00381     Internally the components are always packed.
00382     Internally the lines are arranged from bottom up to top.
00383 
00384     Attributes:
00385       Description (string)
00386 \endverbatim
00387  * \ingroup format */
00388 void imFormatRegisterSGI(void);

00391 /** \defgroup pcx PCX - ZSoft Picture
00392  * \section Description
00393  *
00394  * \par
00395  * Copyright ZSoft Corporation. \n
00396  * ZSoft (1988) PCX Technical Reference Manual.
00397  * \par
00398  * Internal Implementation.
00399  *
00400  * \section Features
00401  *
00402 \verbatim
00403     Data Types: Byte
00404     Color Spaces: RGB, MAP and Binary (Gray saved as MAP)
00405     Compressions:
00406       NONE - no compression
00407       RLE  - Run Lenght Encoding [default - since uncompressed PCX is not well supported]
00408     Only one image.
00409     No alpha channel.
00410     Internally the components are always packed.
00411     Internally the lines are arranged from top down to bottom.
00412 
00413     Attributes:
00414       ResolutionUnit (string) ["DPC", "DPI"]
00415       XResolution, YResolution IM_FLOAT (1)
00416       XScreen, YScreen IM_USHORT (1) screen position
00417 
00418     Comments:
00419       Reads Versions 0-5, but writes Version 5 always.
00420 \endverbatim
00421  * \ingroup format */
00422 void imFormatRegisterPCX(void);

00425 /** \defgroup tga TGA - Truevision Graphics Adapter File
00426  * \section Description
00427  *
00428  * \par
00429  * Truevision TGA File Format Specification Version 2.0 \n
00430  * Technical Manual Version 2.2 January, 1991           \n
00431  * Copyright 1989, 1990, 1991 Truevision, Inc.
00432  * \par
00433  * Internal Implementation.
00434  *
00435  * \section Features
00436  *
00437 \verbatim
00438     Data Types: Byte
00439     Color Spaces: Gray, RGB and MAP (Binary saved as Gray)
00440     Compressions:
00441       NONE - no compression [default]
00442       RLE  - Run Lenght Encoding
00443     Only one image.
00444     Can have an alpha channel (only for RGB)
00445     Internally the components are always packed.
00446     Internally the lines are arranged from bottom up to top or from top down to bottom.
00447 
00448     Attributes:
00449       XScreen, YScreen IM_USHORT (1) screen position
00450       Title, Author, Description, JobName, Software (string)
00451       SoftwareVersion (read only) (string)
00452       DateTimeModified (string) [when writing uses the current system time]
00453       Gamma IM_FLOAT (1)
00454 \endverbatim
00455  * \ingroup format */
00456 void imFormatRegisterTGA(void);

00459 /** \defgroup pnm PNM - Netpbm Portable Image Map
00460  * \section Description
00461  *
00462  * \par
00463  * PNM formats Copyright Jef Poskanzer
00464  * \par
00465  * Internal Implementation.
00466  *
00467  * \section Features
00468  *
00469 \verbatim
00470     Data Types: Byte and UShort
00471     Color Spaces: Gray, RGB and Binary
00472     Compressions:
00473       NONE - no compression [default]
00474       ASCII (textual data)
00475     Can have more than one image, but sequencial access only.
00476     No alpha channel.
00477     Internally the components are always packed.
00478     Internally the lines are arranged from top down to bottom.
00479 
00480     Attributes:
00481       Description (string)
00482 
00483     Comments:
00484       In fact ASCII is an expansion, not a compression, because the file will be larger than binary data.
00485 \endverbatim
00486  * \ingroup format */
00487 void imFormatRegisterPNM(void);

00489 
00490 /** \defgroup ico ICO - Windows Icon
00491  * \section Description
00492  *
00493  * \par
00494  * Windows Copyright Microsoft Corporation.
00495  * \par
00496  * Internal Implementation.
00497  *
00498  * \section Features
00499  *
00500 \verbatim
00501     Data Types: Byte
00502     Color Spaces: RGB, MAP and Binary (Gray saved as MAP)
00503     Compressions:
00504       NONE - no compression [default]
00505     Can have more than one image. But reading and writing is limited to 10 images max,
00506       and all images must have different sizes and bpp.
00507     Can have an alpha channel (only for RGB)
00508     Internally the components are always packed.
00509     Internally the lines are arranged from bottom up to top.
00510 
00511     Attributes:
00512       TransparencyIndex IM_BYTE (1)
00513 
00514     Comments:
00515       If the user specifies an alpha channel, the AND mask is loaded as alpha if
00516         the file color mode does not contain the IM_ALPHA flag.
00517       For MAP imagens, if the user does not specifies an alpha channel
00518         the TransparencyIndex is used to initialize the AND mask when writing,
00519         and if the user does specifies an alpha channel
00520         the most repeated index with transparency will be the transparent index.
00521       Although any size and common bpp can be used is recomended to use the typical configurations:
00522         16x16, 32x32, 48x48, 64x64 or 96x96
00523         2 colors, 16 colors, 256 colors, 24bpp or 32bpp
00524 \endverbatim
00525  * \ingroup format */
00526 void imFormatRegisterICO(void);
00527 
00528 
00529 /** \defgroup krn KRN - IM Kernel File Format
00530  * \section Description
00531  *
00532  * \par
00533  * Textual format to provied a simple way to create kernel convolution images.
00534  * \par
00535  * Internal Implementation.
00536  *
00537  * \section Features
00538  *
00539 \verbatim
00540     Data Types: Int, Float
00541     Color Spaces: Gray
00542     Compressions:
00543       NONE - no compression [default]
00544     Only one image.
00545     No alpha channel.
00546     Internally the lines are arranged from top down to bottom.
00547 
00548     Attributes:
00549       Description (string)
00550 
00551     Comments:
00552       The format is very simple, inspired by PNM.
00553       It was developed because PNM does not have support for INT and FLOAT.
00554       Remeber that usually convolution operations use kernel size an odd number.
00555 
00556     Format Model:
00557       IMKERNEL
00558       Description up to 512 characters
00559       width height
00560       type (0 - IM_INT, 1 - IM_FLOAT)
00561       data...
00562 
00563     Example:
00564       IMKERNEL
00565       Gradian
00566       3 3
00567       0
00568       0 -1 0
00569       0  1 0
00570       0  0 0
00571 \endverbatim
00572  * \ingroup format */
00573 void imFormatRegisterKRN(void);
